Package cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models

Class GameBoardMem

java.lang.Object
cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models.AbsGameBoard
cpsc2150.extendedConnectX.models.GameBoardMem
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGameBoard
public class GameBoardMem
extends AbsGameBoard
implements IGameBoard
A GameBoardMem represents a game board that is stored in memory. It extends the AbsGameBoard abstract class and implements the IGameBoard interface. The board is represented where the keys are the players and the values are the list of positions that the player has marked on the board. @invariant 0 <= ROWS <= 2147483647, 0 <= COLUMNS <= 2147483647,and 0 < NUM_TO_WIN <= min(ROWS, COLUMNS) @correspondence ROWS corresponds to the number of rows on the game board. COLUMNS corresponds to the number of columns on the game board. NUM_TO_WIN corresponds to the number of marks in a row required to win the game. board corresponds to a map where the keys are characters representing players, and the values are lists of BoardPositions representing the positions on the board that each player has marked.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoardMem

      public GameBoardMem​(int numRows, int numColumns, int numToWin)
      Creates a new GameBoardMem with the given number of rows, columns, and marks required to win.
      Parameters:
      numRows - the number of rows in the game board.
      numColumns - the number of columns in the game board.
      numToWin - the number of marks in a row required to win the game.
      Pre:
      numRows, numColumns, and numToWin are all greater than 0.
      Post:
      A new GameBoardMem object is created with an empty board of size numRows x numColumns.

      public void placeToken​(char p, int c)
      Description copied from interface: IGameBoard
      Places the character p in column c. The token will be placed in the lowest available row in column c.
      Specified by:

      Parameters:

    • whatsAtPos

      public char whatsAtPos​(BoardPosition pos)
      Description copied from interface: IGameBoard
      Returns the character that is in the GameBoard at the specified position. If no marker is present at the position, a blank space character is returned.
      Specified by:
      whatsAtPos in interface IGameBoard
      Parameters:
      pos - the BoardPosition to check for a marker
      Returns:
      the character at the specified position, or a blank space character if no marker is present
